did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: M. H. De Young Memorial Museum collection,

origination.label: Collector
origination.corpname: M. H. De Young Memorial Museum

physdesc.label: Collection Size
physdesc.extent: 3 manuscript boxes, 1 oversize envelope, 1 framed newspaper sheet

did.abstract: Photographs, maps, proclamations, and printed matter, relating to World War I. Includes United States Shipping Board posters, photographs of the American Expeditionary Forces in France, battle maps, statistical summaries concerning the American Expeditionary Forces, German proclamations in France and Belgium, and a letter from General John J. Pershing to Congressman Julius Kahn. Collected by the M. H. De Young Memorial Museum.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], M. H. De Young Memorial Museum Collection, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

did.unittitle: German pamphlet, To the American Soldier of German Descent (in English)
German pamphlet, Furchte Dich Nicht
German leaflet, "An Heer Und Heimat" (To Army and Home), 1918 September 2
German loan poster, with insets of agricultural implements, horse and cow on outer border

Newspaper issue, La Libre Belgique, no. 78, 1916 June
News sheet, 1919 January 15 (in French and Flemish)
Swiss ration cards: 2 milk cards, 1 food fat card, and 1 bread card

French map of Paris and environs: air raid over Paris, 1918 June 27-28
French map of Paris and environs: air raid over Paris, 1918 June 15-16

Battle map, "Extract of Metz-Commercy, May 21, 1918," St. Mihiel Offensive
Map, "The Meuse-Argonne Offensive," France, Base Printing Plant, 29th Engineers, U.S.A., 1918
Map, "Distribution of U.S. Forces, August 9, 1918, France"
Map, "Second Battle of the Marne" (disposition of U.S. forces)

Battle "Ostend, Belgium," Geographical Section, General Staff, no. 2364, British War Office, 1911
Map, "The Western Theater of the European War" by Prof. B. Barrecchia, 1919, showing route taken by Congressman Julius Kahn and party
Map, German, "Rhineland and Westphalia"
Map, German, sightseeing, "Relief Panorama of the Rhine"
Map, "The St. Mihiel Salient, September 12-15,1918," Base Printing Plant, 29th Engineers, U.S.A., 1919
Chart showing in color the shoulder patches of the units of the American Expeditionary Forces, Base Printing Plant, 29th Engineers, U.S.A., 1918
Ten receipts for merchandise from Cologne, Germany, 1918 April 3
Three American military transit passes issued to Congressman Julius Kahn, dated 1919 April 2, Headquarters, 3rd Army, Coblenz, Germany
American pass issued to Congressman Julius Kahn, 1919 April 2, Headquarters, 3rd Army
Three military transit passes issued to Dr. Morris Herzstein, 1919 April 2, Headquarters, 3rd Army, Coblenz, Germany
Passenger identification card issued to Morris Merzstein, U.S. Customs, New York City, 1919 March 9
Tabulation of air raids over Paris in 1918. Typescript (in English)
Travel order issued to Dr. Morris Merzstein to board the SS Leviathan, 1919 May 13, Brest, France
Description of Camp Pontenazen, France, embarkation point for U.S. soldiers returning to America. Typescript
Invitation extended to Congressman Julius Kahn by the 322nd Field Signal Battalion, 1919 March 24, signed by all Californians in the battalion. Typescript
Description of Camp St. Sulpice, France. Typescript
Letter to Congressman Julius Kahn from Chief of Staff, 80th Division, 1919 March 27; and General Order no. 2, Headquarters, 80th Division, 1919 March 26. Typescript
Newspaper issue, The Amroc News, Coblenz, Germany, 1919 June 28, published by Americans in occupied Germany. (this issue announces the signing of the Peace Treaty)
Battle map of Verdun: operation of the 181st and 182nd Brigades, U.S.A., on 1918 August 12

Volume, Summary Statistics of the American Expeditionary Forces
Booklet, Return of Troops to the U.S. From November 11, 1918 to May 31, 1919: Report for Month of May

Document in portfolio, "History of the Signing of the Treaty of Peace, As Recorded by Original Telegrams Filed at the U.S. Signal Corps Telegraph Office, Palace of Versailles, 1919 June 28"
Two admission tickets to reviewing stand for review of the last division, U.S.A., 1919 September 17, Washington, D.C.
Portfolio of 16 war photographs, U.S. Army Signal Corps
Proclamation demanding the reporting to German authorities of all English military refugees, posted in Mons, France, 1914 November 16 (in French)
Proclamation posted in Brussels, Belgium, 1914 August 20, by Burgomaster Adolphe Max

Proclamation posted in the Ardennes, 1914 August 25, by Captain Schultzee, German Commander (in French)
Proclamation posted at Cugnon, 1914 October, by Burgomaster Delmue (in French)
Proclamation posted in Brussels, Belgium, 1916 July 12, by Lt. General Hurt, German Governor of Brussels and Brabant (in German, French and Flemish)
Poster announcing the closing of all stores as mute manifestation of the Belgian National Fete Day, year? July 21
Poster posted in Louvain, Belgium, 1914 October 24, by the provisional burgomaster, protesting the German taking of hostages
Proclamation posted in Ghent, Belgium, 1915 June 10, by Lt. General von Westarp (in German, French and Flemish)
Proclamation posted in Brussels, 1914 September 25, by Baron von der Goltz, Governor General of Belgium (in German, French and Flemish)

Proclamation posted in Antwerp, 1914 October 9, by Von Beseler, Commander in Chief of the German Armies
Proclamation posted in Louvain, 1914 October 1, by the German Governor General of Brussels (in German, French and Flemish)
Proclamation posted in the Ardennes, 1914 August 29, by Becker, Commander in Chief (in French)
Proclamation by German General von Luttewitz announcing the arrest of the Belgian mayor, 1914 September 26 (in German and French)
Proclamation posted in the Ardennes, 1914 August 21, by the burgomaster on German order
Proclamation posted in the Ardennes, 1914 August 30, by the burgomaster
Proclamation posted in St. Trond, 1914 September 6, by Lt. Colonel Bleyhoffer (in German, French and Flemish)
German war news poster posted in Brussels, 1914 September 6, by the German Military Government (in German, French and Flemish)
German proclamation posted in Belgium, 1914 (in German)
German war news poster posted in Belgium, 1914 September 29 (in French, German and Flemish)
German war news poster posted in Belgium (in French, German and Flemish)
Proclamation posted in Brussels, 1915 October 12, announcing the condemnation to death of Nurse Cavell
Illustrated Belgian poster, Royal Institution of Messines, near Ypres, for the daughters of Belgian officers and soldiers, killed and wounded
The Marshall Foch Victory-Marmony Banner
Five booklets, Scraps of Paper, on German proclamations in Belgium and France, with foreword by Ian Malcolm, M.P., London, 1916
Newspaper issue, La Libre Belgique, no. 126, 1917 August
Letter from General John J. Pershing to Congressman Julius Kahn, 1919 November 5, re universal military training
Booklet, Personnel Statistics Report: Strength of Army as of October 1, 1919, copy no. 24

Program for the Aviators Ball, Hotel Ritz Carlton, New York City, 1919 April 26
Sheet music, "When Madelon" or "Quand Madelon," published by L. Bousquet, Paris

858 R. Certificate pertaining to Henry Lux (in German)
